;;多米尼克护照
;

;加勒比海国家多米尼克已向数千人出售公民身份，其中包括一名前对阿富汗颇具争议的“黄金护照”计划的首次详细调查发现了阿富汗间谍头子、被判犯有欺诈罪的土耳其百万富翁以及穆阿迈尔·卡扎菲领导下的前利比亚上校。

;

;调查结果来自多米尼加：加勒比地区，由《卫报》和其他 14 个国际新闻机构与;有组织犯罪和腐败报道组织合作进行的一项调查项目; (OCCRP)。

;

;多米尼克的黄金护照计划是世界上最大的计划之一，据官方声明，自 2009 年以来，该计划已通过投资入籍计划筹集了超过 10 亿美元（8.22 亿英镑）。

;

;其护照在世界各地都很受欢迎，一系列国际协议确保其公民免签证前往 140 个国家/地区，其中包括大多数欧盟成员国。

;

;但是，到目前为止，每人支付至少 100,000 美元（82,000 英镑）的价格以获得多米尼加国籍的个人的姓名 - 在许多情况下没有踏上该岛 - 很难获得。

;

;通过与政府问责项目（一个总部位于美国的倡导组织，该组织在加勒比地区的档案馆和图书馆中搜寻官方公共文件的副本）合作，并通过审查泄露的材料，该项目能够编制出数千名被指控者的名单。多米尼加官方政府公报上首次公布的名单显示，自 2007 年以来，这个人口仅超过 70,000 人的岛国已向 7,700 人授予公民身份 - 尽管我们的研究表明可能还有数千人。有些人通过移民或婚姻入籍，但绝大多数人购买了公民身份。

; ;

;任何政府都有权就谁成为公民制定自己的标准。对于许多生活在压迫政权下的人来说，第二国籍可以提供安全感。拥有伊朗、中国和俄罗斯血统的名字是成为公民的最大群体之一。

;

;对于来自这些国家的个人来说，多米尼克护照还意味着在过境时可以减少繁文缛节，业务或在国外开设银行账户。

;

;一些调查结果引发了有关该计划的透明度和治理的问题，有些调查结果可能会让多米尼克感到尴尬。

;

;一位买家曾公开表示另一人在获得公民身份之前被​​指控犯有战争罪，另一人曾是穆阿迈尔·卡扎菲领导下的上校和高级安全官员。如果投资申请人有犯罪记录，他们将被禁止获得公民身份，但在一个例子中，一名买家在获得公民身份之前似乎因欺诈而入狱。其他人自从获得多米尼加公民身份后就遇到了麻烦，其中包括国际刑警组织红色通缉名单上的一名人。

; ;

;多米尼克已变得严重依赖出售公民身份为其公共服务提供资金，这一收入来源约占政府所有收入的一半。

;

;对该计划的担忧给出生的多米尼加人带来了后果。英国政府于 7 月份停止了多米尼克和其他四个国家的免签证旅行。

;

;多米尼克政府没有回应详细的置评请求。然而，自 2004 年上任以来一直负责监督公民销售扩张的总理罗斯福·斯凯里特 (Roosevelt Skerrit) 在 9 月 18 日和 10 月 3 日的新闻发布会上为该计划进行了辩护，显然是为了回应这项调查。

;

;他说：“我们声称拥有一个强大的系统，我们会在不同层面进行尽职调查，如果有人今天和明天早上成为公民，那么这个人去做某事，就会发现自己遇到了法律问题，你不能为此责怪程序。”

; ;

;斯凯里特将多米尼加计划与美国的绿卡进行了比较，后者赋予永久居留权。他说，当人们在获得居留权后犯下罪行时，没有人会责怪美国。

;

;他还提出了一系列荒唐和虚假的说法，称参与调查的记者是由多米尼加反对派政客付钱的，目的是“摧毁美国”。 ”该计划，并将记者比作纵火犯和“恐怖分子”。

;

;* * *

;

;多米尼加的国家档案馆坐落在现代化的混凝土结构中，坐落在粉红色的殖民建筑之中罗索小镇，该岛的首府。在这里，可以找到每周多米尼加官方公报的字符串装订期。

;

;该公报是有关数千名已成为多米尼加公民的个人的唯一官方公共信息来源。仅以纸质形式发布，没有官方数字副本，公报中包含的信息不易获取。

; ;

;去年，政府问责项目采取了提高透明度的行动。它查看了图书馆、私人收藏和牙买加西印度群岛大学的数十份公报，并制定了 2007 年至 2022 年每位入籍公民的名单。

;

;在泄露的文件中还发现了其他名字。一家酒店开发商获得许可接受护照买家作为投资者。

; ;

;曝光的名字中包括阿萨杜拉·哈立德 (Asadullah Khalid)，他曾担任阿富汗两个省的省长、该国的间谍头子，后来担任国防部长。他在 2001 年美国及其盟国入侵后的动荡时期担任这些高级职位，直到 2021 年塔利班接管。

;

;哈立德一直是 ;英国和加拿大官员指控;对侵犯人权负有责任，包括 2012 年广泛报道的指控，他的宾馆下面有一间酷刑室。他于 2017 年获得公民身份，当时 ;指控已经公开;。

;

;针对哈立德的指控从未在法庭上得到检验。他此前曾表示，没有证据表明这些指控“只是宣传”。哈立德没有回应置评请求。

;

;另一位投资者是萨西·米鲁德·萨西·格拉达 (Sasi Milud Sasi Grada)，他是利比亚卡扎菲政权下的前上校。

;

;格拉达逃离利比亚后于 2015 年获得公民身份。推翻卡扎菲的内战结束后返回。格拉达在接受电话采访时表示，虽然他从1960年代起就认识卡扎菲，但当他们一起在军队接受训练时，他并没有与卡扎菲讨论政治。他说，他于 1989 年以上校军衔退役，之后负责银行、大学和油田等设施的政府安全工作，直到内战为止。

;

;根据多米尼加法规，投资申请人在下列情况下将被禁止获得公民身份：他们有犯罪记录。然而，尽管似乎被判犯有欺诈罪，但一名个人似乎能够购买公民身份。

;

;土耳其商人兼前政府部长 Cavit Çağlar 于 2011 年购买了公民身份，即他入狱七年后因与 Interbank 相关的欺诈行为被判刑并处以罚款，Interbank 是他所拥有的一家银行，直到 1999 年被土耳其监管机构接管。2010 年，他的刑期被缓刑，并减至一年零九个月的监禁，并处以罚款。土耳其报纸 Hürriyet 报道。

;

;在 ;2019 年采访;中，Çağlar 表示他在监狱服刑九个半月，他不是罪犯。 Çağlar 报业公司 Olay 的一名代表表示，当《卫报》和 OCCRP 联系他时，他不想发表评论。

;

;其他人在获得护照后似乎遇到了麻烦。

;

;根据国际刑警组织的红色通缉令，迈赫迪·易卜拉希米·埃什拉塔巴迪 (Mehdi Ebrahimi Eshratabadi) 是一位自获得公民身份以来就面临不当行为指控的投资者，他是一名伊朗人，因涉嫌欺诈而被伊朗通缉。

;

;埃什拉塔巴迪 (Eshratabadi)，又名托尼·纽曼 (Tony Newman)， 2015 年获得多米尼加公民身份。他的律师将伊朗于 2020 年 2 月将他列入国际刑警组织通缉名单的行为描述为“伊朗政府滥用红色通缉令制度”。该律师表示，他极力否认伊朗政权的指控，并在伊朗的刑事诉讼中为自己辩护。

;

;Oday Nadir Abdulkareem al-Quraishi，伊拉克人，于 2012 年获得多米尼加护照，然后搬到迪拜。 ，根据之前泄露的财产记录。 2016 年，媒体报道称，他在一家伊拉克国有石油公司担任工程师时，在 2009 年至 2011 年间收受贿赂，为石油服务公司 Unaoil 的客户提供利润丰厚的合同。次年，伊拉克就这些指控发出了逮捕令。

;

;他否认有任何不当行为，并表示他因为“安全和种族问题”而离开伊拉克，并且“早在这一切开始之前[编辑]”。他通过电子邮件表示，“一旦安全情况和时间合适”，他将解决此事。

; ;

;凯尔·戴维斯加密货币领域的领先者，似乎于 2009 年获得了多米尼加护照。他于 2012 年与他人共同创立了三箭资本对冲基金。然而，;基金于 2022 年崩溃;，这是由加密货币暴跌，导致投资者声称损失数十亿美元。

;

;该基金的清算人 Teneo 上个月在一份声明中表示，新加坡已向戴维斯发出“拘押令”，判处他入狱四个月戴维斯的律师因未能配合清算程序而被起诉，“但目前仍下落不明”。

;

;在《卫报》联系到戴维斯的律师时，他对清算人提出了批评。他们没有解决有关他公民身份的问题。

;

;* * *

;

;近年来，黄金护照和居留计划成倍增加。多米尼加的计划是最便宜的计划之一，需要直接向政府捐赠 10 万美元，或投资 20 万美元购买政府批准的房地产项目。

;

;前法国殖民地，后为英国殖民地，位于东部加勒比地区的多米尼加于1978年获得独立。自1993年以来，它出售了公民身份。 2015 年之后，销售开始真正起飞，当时与欧盟签署了一项条约，保障其公民;申根区免签旅行;，每年最多 90 天。

; ;

;反腐败活动家和政界人士长期以来一直对黄金护照制度表示担忧。

;

;反腐败监督机构透明国际的活动负责人埃卡·罗斯托马什维利 (Eka Rostomashvili) 表示： “众所周知，前往欧盟和英国的免签证旅行一直是加勒比投资公民计划的主要卖点之一。欧盟和英国在此类计划上都遇到了相当多的麻烦，导致一些欧盟国家和英国完全关闭了自己的计划。”

;

;英国去年取消了黄金签证计划，而塞浦路斯在2020年停止出售公民身份。

;

;然而，黄金护照在多米尼加经济中发挥着核心作用。该国领导人表示，需要这笔资金来取代因贸易规则变化而受损的一度占主导地位的香蕉出口。

; ;

;收入——自 2009 年以来估计超过 10 亿美元——已成为主要来源多米尼加政府的收入，帮助资助学校、医疗保健和其他公共服务。

;

;在 ;上个月的新闻发布会;，斯凯里特表示，它“承担了岛上经济和社会发展的重要部分”，并且“已被用于建造数千所房屋，改善医疗保健，帮助以国家安全为中心，通过建设酒店帮助您实现经济多元化并发展农业和旅游业经济。

; Wed, 11 Oct 2023 13:52:02 +0800 Record number of Poles abroad register to vote in electionhttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/oct/11/poles-living-abroad-register-vote-election
;;2023-10-11T04:00:30Z;
;
;;波兰反对派中右翼公民平台党领袖唐纳德·图斯克
;

;超过一半由于执政党法律与选举委员会的支持，已有 100 万人在国外登记参加周日的波兰选举投票。正义党希望史无前例地连续第三个任期。

;

;波兰外交部长兹比格涅夫·劳 (Zbigniew Rau) 周二表示，他预计海外选民的数量;在之前超过 600,000;午夜截止日期，创下该国历史上的纪录。

;

;“四年前，有 314,000 名[在国外登记的选民]；目前有 560,000 人，”Rau 在新闻发布会上说道。

;

;波兰拥有大量海外侨民，;估计有 500 万波兰公民;居住在国外。在2019年的上一次选举中，海外波兰人比居住在国内的波兰人更有可能投票给反对派，公民联盟（KO）获得了39%的海外选票，但仅占总选票的25%。

;

;2015 年首次当选的右翼、民粹主义和社会保守派法律与正义党正面临着来自反对派团体的严峻挑战;由前首相;和欧洲理事会主席唐纳德·图斯克领导。民意调查显示，竞选将势均力敌。

;

;卡西娅·格泽拉克 (Kasia Grzelak) 是一名来自纽卡斯尔的艺术老师，她从七岁起就住在英国，她表示，她在波兰选举中投下第一票是因为赌注很大显得如此之高。

;
;

;;相关：;;波兰选举：谁是关键参与者以及利害攸关的是什么？;

;
;

;“我从未投票过在之前的波兰选举中，这将是我第一次，”格泽拉克说。 “这次选举感觉更重要。我的家人给我发消息要求我登记。”

;

;Grzelak 表示，她将投票给唐纳德·图斯克 (Donald Tusk) 领导的反对派中右翼公民平台 (PO)，后者表示他将根据要求将堕胎合法化如果他当选总理，则怀孕长达 12 周。波兰拥有欧洲最严格的堕胎法。

;

;“它们是两害相权取其轻，”她说。 “我投票的主要原因是 PiS 受到限制 ;堕胎权;。对于现在的年轻女性来说，这是非常可怕的。有家人在那里，我看到了关于怀孕的很多恐惧。我认为这太可怕了。因此，我将投票给一个我认为能够修正这一点、并且具有更好道德的政党。”

;

;Rau 在周二的讲话中表示，这就是需求，海外选举委员会的数量必须减少增加 70% 以满足“波兰人的民主需求”。

;

;一月份，政府;通过了一项有争议的法案;，该法案要求海外选举委员会在 24 小时内提交计票结果，否则将认为选票无效。这些时间限制不适用于设在波兰的选举委员会，引发人们对该法案试图限制反对派选票数量的担忧。

;

;波兰人权事务专员 Marcin Wiącek 表示，该法案违宪并违反了选举法，他说该法“没有根据居住地区分参与选举的权利”。

;

;自 2016 年以来一直居住在英国的埃瓦·波斯皮辛斯卡 (Ewa Pospieszyńska) 表示，她担心新法律。 “我担心我的选票不起作用。我什至考虑过回波兰，”她说。她补充说，她一直在寻找登记选民人数最少的伦敦委员会，以尽量减少她的选票被作废的可能性。

;

;这将是波斯皮辛斯卡第三次在国外投票，但她表示，这次选举感觉更多重要的。 “我们预计会出现悬浮议会。决定谁将进入执政联盟非常重要，”她说。 “我一直在竭尽全力鼓励人们投票。我已经设法让至少五个朋友注册，但我一直在给每个人发消息。”

;

;PiS 活动，其中大部分内容都集中在声称它是唯一能够照顾国家安全的部队在周二遭受挫折，包括总参谋长在内的两名高级军事指挥官;递交了辞呈。;

;

;“这是一个象征性的决定。他们决定在选举前采取这一步骤，以表明他们对这个政治阶层没有信心，”前外交部长 Jacek Czaputowicz 告诉新闻门户网站 Onet.pl。

; Wed, 11 Oct 2023 13:22:02 +0800 Kari Lake, Trump ally and election denier, announces Senate bid in Arizonahttps://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2023/oct/10/kari-lake-senate-bid-arizona-announcement
;;2023-10-11T03:02:59Z;
;
;;前亚利桑那州州长候选人卡里·莱克 (Kari Lake) 出席 3 月 4 日在马里兰州举行的保守派政治行动会议 (CPAC) 2023 年。
;

;在亚利桑那州州长竞选中落败但从未承认失败的共和党候选人卡里·莱克 (Kari Lake) 周二宣布竞选西部州的美国参议员。

;

;一位前电视台新闻主播莱克通过反复发表有关选举的虚假言论进入政坛。她与前总统唐纳德·特朗普关系密切，并被认为是特朗普的潜在竞选伙伴，特朗普;曾经赞扬莱克;不断提出选举舞弊的能力。

;

;莱克已将否认选举的事实告上法庭，;到目前为止未成功;，她试图声称自己是亚利桑那州的合法州长。她的法律团队受到了 ;法院制裁;在;两种不同的情况;中。

;

;莱克宣布参选周二在斯科茨代尔，距离;提交文件;一周后参议院出价。

;

;“我不会撤退。据美国有线电视新闻网 (CNN) 报道，莱克对一群支持者说：“我将和你们每一个人一起站在这座山顶上，我知道当我正式宣布竞选美国参议员时，你们就在我身边。”

;

;莱克在共和党参议员竞选之后;2022 年在摇摆州输掉了重大竞选;。民主党参议员马克·凯利 (Mark Kelly) 击败了共和党商人布莱克·马斯特斯 (Blake Masters)。莱克以约 17,000 票之差输掉了州长竞选，共和党也输掉了国务卿和司法部长竞选。莱克未能赢得独立选民的支持，独立选民约占亚利桑那州选民的三分之一，并疏远了主流共和党人。

;

;该州的参议员竞选将是该国竞争最激烈、成本最高的竞选之一。如果曾经是民主党人、现在是独立人士的现任参议员基尔斯滕·西内玛 (Kyrsten Sinema) 决定竞选连任，那么它的动态可能会特别困难。

;

;The new charges, revealed in a superseding indictment returned on Tuesday by a grand jury in New York, increases the legal peril for the embattled congressman, given that his former campaign treasurer, Nancy Marks, last week pleaded guilty to defrauding the United States.

;The original indictment filed in May accused Santos of engaging in multiple instances of fraud, money laundering, theft of public funds and making false statements. Santos, who won his congressional seat through a campaign built partly on falsehoods, ;pleaded not guilty; to those charges.

;The updated, 23-count indictment detailed two more fraudulent schemes: the credit card scheme, and a conspiracy to submit to the Federal Election Commission (FEC) false reports that inflated his campaign's fundraising so it could deceive the ;Republican; party into extending financial support.

;

;In the credit card scheme, Santos is alleged to have devised a way to steal the identities and financial information of his campaign donors, which were used to charge their credit cards and caused money to be deposited into his campaign, other campaigns, and his own bank account.

;

;The scheme involved one instance where Santos allegedly stole the billing details of a donor's two credit cards and made transfers to his campaign. To get around the fact that they exceeded legal limits, prosecutors said, Santos falsely listed himself and relatives as the sources of the funds.

;

;On one occasion, prosecutors said, Santos charged $12,000 to the donor's credit card – money that mostly ended up in his personal bank account.

;

;In the Republican party deception scheme, Santos is alleged to have conspired with Marks to file FEC reports that falsely claimed his campaign had raised $250,000 from third-party donors in a single quarter, the threshold needed to unlock financial support from the GOP.

;

;The deception included false FEC reports that said at least 10 family members of Santos and Marks had made significant contributions to the campaign, as well as false reports that said Santos had loaned large amounts of money to his campaign, including one $500,000 loan.

;

;Confronted on Capitol Hill as he emerged from a closed-door House Republican conference meeting, shortly after the superseding indictment was unsealed by reporters, Santos insisted he had not seen the new allegations and that he would not resign his seat.

;

;“I did not have access to my phone. I have no clue what you guys are talking about,” Santos told CNN.

;

;The congressman is set to appear in federal court on 27 October, where he is likely to be arraigned on the new charges against him. A spokesperson for Santos did not immediately respond to a request for comment on Tuesday night and on whether he would plead not guilty.

;

;Santos faces escalating legal peril after Marks last week ;pleaded guilty to one count of conspiracy to defraud the United States; by committing one or more federal offenses after cooperating with prosecutors, even if her lawyer claimed she had not entered into a formal plea agreement.

;

;Marks said in a prepared statement at her arraignment in federal district court on Long Island that she had given the FEC a list of fake people who had supposedly given money to the campaign. Outside the courthouse, her lawyer said she could testify against Santos at trial.

;

;“If we get a subpoena, we'll do the right thing,” said her lawyer Ray Perini. “There's a manipulation involved that had to do with her family and the death of her husband,” he added without elaborating further. “There were lies told.”

;Dorothy Hoffner, a 104-year-old Chicago woman whose recent skydive could see her certified by Guinness World Records as the oldest person to ever jump from a plane, has died.

;
;

;;Related: ;;'It was wonderful up there': 104-year-old aims for world's oldest skydiver record;

;
;

;Hoffner's close friend, Joe Conant, said she was found dead Monday morning by staff at the Brookdale Lake View senior living community. Conant said Hoffner apparently died in her sleep on Sunday night.

;

;Conant, who is a nurse, said he met Hoffner – whom he called Grandma at her request – several years ago while he was working as a caregiver for another resident at the senior living center. He said she had amazing energy and remained mentally sharp.

;

;“She was indefatigable. She just kept going,” he said Tuesday. “She was not someone who would take naps in the afternoon, or not show up for any function, dinner or anything else. She was always there, fully present. She kept going, always.”

;

;On 1 October, Hoffner made a tandem skydive that could land her in the record books as the world's oldest skydiver. She jumped out of a plane from 13,500ft (4,100 metres) at Skydive Chicago in Ottawa, Illinois, 85 miles (140km) south-west of Chicago.

;

;“Age is just a number,” Hoffner told a cheering crowd moments after landing. It was not her first time jumping from a plane – that happened when she was a spry 100 years of age.

;

;Conant said he was working through paperwork to ensure that Guinness World Records certifies Hoffner posthumously as the world's oldest skydiver, but he expects that will take some time. The current record was set in May 2022 by 103-year-old Linnéa Ingegärd Larsson of Sweden.

;

;Conant said Hoffner didn't skydive to break a record. He said she had so thoroughly enjoyed her first jump that she just wanted to do it again.

;

;“She had no intention of breaking the record. And she had no interest in any publicity or anything. She wasn't doing it for any other reason than she wanted to go skydiving,” he said.

;

;“It was wonderful up there,” Hoffner had said after last week's jump. “The whole thing was delightful, wonderful, couldn't have been better.”

;

;

;“We are deeply saddened by Dorothy's passing and feel honored to have been a part of making her world-record skydive a reality.

;

;“Skydiving is an activity that many of us safely tuck away in our bucket lists. But Dorothy reminds us that it's never too late to take the thrill of a lifetime. We are forever grateful that skydiving was a part of her exciting, well-lived life,” they said.

;

;Conant said Hoffner worked for more than four decades as a telephone operator with Illinois Bell, which later became AT&T, and retired 43 years ago. The lifelong Chicago resident never married, and Conant said she had no immediate family members.

;A memorial service for Hoffner will be held in early November.

;

;“She was a dear friend who was an inspiration,” Conant said.

; Wed, 11 Oct 2023 08:22:01 +0800 Female frogs appear to fake death to avoid unwanted advances, study showshttps://www.theguardian.com/science/2023/oct/11/female-frogs-fake-death-unwanted-advances-study
;;2023-10-10T23:01:23Z;
;
;;European common frogs mating
;

;When it comes to avoiding unwanted male attention, researchers have found some frogs take drastic action: they appear to feign death.

;

;Researchers say the findings shed new light on the European common frog, suggesting females do not simply put up with the male scramble for mates – a situation in which several males can end up clinging to a female, sometimes fatally.

;

;“It was previously thought that females were unable to choose or defend themselves against this male coercion,” said Dr Carolin Dittrich, the first author of the study from the Natural History Museum of Berlin.

;

;But the research suggests this may not be the case. “Females in these dense breeding aggregations are not passive as previously thought,” Dittrich said.

;

;;Writing in the journal Royal Society Open Science;, Dittrich and her co-author, Dr Mark-Oliver Rödel, report how they placed each male frog in a box with two females: one large and one small. The mating behaviour was then recorded on video.

;

;The results, obtained from 54 females who experienced the clutches of a male, revealed that 83% of females gripped by a male tried rotating their body.

;

;Release calls such as grunts and squeaks were emitted by 48% of clasped females – all of whom also rotated their body.

;

;Tonic immobility – stiffening with arms and legs outstretched in a pose reminiscent of playing dead – occurred in 33% of all females clasped by a male, with the team adding it tended to occur alongside rotating and calling.

;

;Smaller females, they note, more frequently employed all three tactics together than larger ones.

;

;While unusual, tonic immobility – it turned out – had been seen before. “I found a book written in 1758 by Rösel von Rosenhoff describing this behaviour, which was never mentioned again,” Dittrich said.

;

;The team says tonic immobility could be a stress response. They found this was more common in smaller and therefore younger females, which could be a result of greater stress arising with less experience of reproduction.

;

;The three tactics, they add, allowed at least some females to evade the clutches of the males. “Displaying of mate avoidance behaviour resulted in the escape of 25 females.”

;

;However, the researchers acknowledge the behaviours may have other purposes, suggesting that while female rotations may help them dislodge a male, it could be a way to test the male's strength and endurance – traits that could boost their survival chances if the male can fend off rivals and prevent a “mating ball”.

;

;The study also has limitations, including that a larger sample size is needed to investigate whether smaller females are indeed more successful at escaping, as the research hints, and that only one male was presented to each pair of females.

;

;“In the real world we often observe the formation of mating balls, but also that females can more easily dive away because there is more structure and places to hide,” Dittrich said, adding that while the tactics identified could be successful in nature as well, it was not clear to what degree.

;

;However, Dittrich noted the study gave fresh insight on the behaviour of the females. “I think even if we call this species a common frog and think we know it well, there are still aspects we don't know and perhaps haven't thought about,” she said.

;His platform has leveraged discontent with the Labour government and political and media “elites” – figures long decried by Peters, although he has held some of New Zealand's highest elected offices himself and selected Labour and Jacinda Ardern to govern after the 2017 election.

;

;Along with the party's traditional pledge to curb immigration, Peters has in 2023 adopted anti-transgender stances and opposition to vaccine mandates, and deepened his scorn for policies of shared decision-making with Māori, New Zealand's Indigenous people. Peters, who is Māori, prompted widespread rebuke in September when he ;claimed Māori were not Indigenous; to New Zealand.

; ;

;When asked their view of NZ First holding the balance of power after Saturday's vote, 48% of respondents said it would be bad for New Zealand; 26% said it would be a good thing. On Peters, 20% felt strongly positive, while 47% were strongly negative.

;
;

;;Related: ;;When people feel hopeless about politics, 'vote-tripling' can inspire them. Could it work for New Zealand? | Max Harris;

;
;

;Hipkins, a career politician, recorded 44% strongly positive sentiment and 27% strongly negative; the results were 33% strongly positive for Luxon, a former airline chief executive, with 40% strongly negative.

;

;But respondents again showed a lack of enthusiasm – as in ;previous Guardian Essential NZ Polls; – for the major party leaders, with 42% saying none of the current options for prime minister really appealed to them.

;

;The uncertainty about who New Zealanders want to govern was underscored by the 27% of those surveyed who said what they had seen or heard during the election campaign had changed how they intended to vote.
